New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them
Key Match Events: Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42, tying the eighth largest in the NBA’s shot clock era
Cavaliers equaled the team record for points in a half
Cavaliers committed 19 turnovers that led to 30 points against the Warriors
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson couldn’t help but smile as he looked at the box score and stared at the record of his Cleveland Cavaliers
Atkinson’s high-powered offense has been a great fit for Cleveland, which leads the league in points per game at 124.5 and with a.526 field goal percentage
Under now-Detroit coach JB Bickerstaff last season, the Cavaliers averaged 112.6 points and shot.479 from the field – with the same top nine players on their roster
Ten players are averaging at least 15 minutes a game, but none are logging more than 30
Post-Match Reflections: Donovan Mitchell said, 'We’re playing fast and we’re playing the right way'
Ty Jerome, who scored a season-high 20 points against Golden State, said, 'Everyone is making shots and everyone is having fun'
Jarrett Allen said, 'We have a long way to go, a lot of stuff to clean up, which is great'
